Dots

Class DotsGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dots.DotsGame

  • public class DotsGame
extends java.lang.Object
    The general dots game, that wraps the board, logic and locks together Stores information about the points that are held by each player Created by JiaHao on 25/2/15.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean doMove(DotsInteraction interaction)
      The primary method that we will call on our game, to update the game based on an input DotsInteraction In this method, we will also check for a change for the board, when the interaction is touchUp and certain dots on the screen need to be cleared.

      DotsLocks getGameLocks()

    • Method Detail

      • doMove

        public boolean doMove(DotsInteraction interaction)
        The primary method that we will call on our game, to update the game based on an input DotsInteraction In this method, we will also check for a change for the board, when the interaction is touchUp and certain dots on the screen need to be cleared.
        Parameters:
        interaction - touch interaction
        Returns:
        true if valid, false if invalid

      • getDotsBoard

        public DotsBoard getDotsBoard()

        Returns an arrayList of points held by the other player
        Parameters:
        player - current player
        Returns:

      • getScores

        public int[] getScores()
        Escape to get a copy of the scores
        Returns:
        copied scores

      • isGameRunning

        public boolean isGameRunning()

      • playerAffected

        private void playerAffected(int playerAffected)
        Triggered when the input player is affected
        Parameters:
        playerAffected - the player that is affected

      • playerPointBelowOtherPlayer

        private boolean playerPointBelowOtherPlayer(int currentPlayerId)
        Checks if the current player Id contains moves below the other player
        Parameters:
        currentPlayerId - player that is currently making touches
        Returns:
        true if the current player contains points below that of the other player, false otherwise

      • samePointConflict

        private boolean samePointConflict(DotsInteraction dotsInteraction)
        This method will check for any conflicts in touches between players. I.e. if player0 is holding on to a point, player1 will not be allowed to select that point
        Parameters:
        dotsInteraction - interaction of a particular player
        Returns:
        false if no conflict, true if there is a conflict

      • scoreChanged

        private void scoreChanged(int playerId,
                int noOfDotsCleared)
        Method to update the player scores based on the number of dots cleared by a player
        Parameters:
        playerId - player id
        noOfDotsCleared - number of dots cleared

        scores
